info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 6 at 1:34AM CDT by NWS Nashville TN
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee...
Mill Creek Near Nolensville affecting Davidson County.
For the Mill Creek...including Nolensville...elevated river levels are forecast.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Mill Creek near Nolensville.
* WHEN...From early this morning until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Water begins to flood low lying areas along the creek, including portions of Culbertson Rd east of Nolensville Pike and walking trails near the Honey Brook subdivision. Water also approaches Bluff Road west of Nolensville Pike.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 12.6 feet and rising. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 145 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
